article.headline: Creighton 82, Drake 67
article.story: OMAHA, Neb. (AP) -- Nate Funk scored a career-high 26 points, 18 in the first half, to lead Creighton to an 82-67 victory over Drake on Wednesday night. Creighton (12-6, 4-3 Missouri Valley Conference), scored the game's first eight points and never trailed. Funk's total surpassed his previous best of 22 and also established a single-game record for the 2-year-old Qwest Center Omaha. He was 10-for-14 including 7-for-9 in the first half from the field. He also made four 3-pointers as Creighton collectively was 11-for-26 from beyond the arc. Dane Watts, who made three 3-pointers, added 17 points and Johnny Mathies 12 for the Bluejays. Drake (6-9, 2-5) was led by Pete Eggers with 13 points, Chaun Brooks with 12 and Lonnie Randolph with 10. After trailing by 10 at halftime, the Bulldogs missed a layup that would have cut the deficit to four with about 14 minutes to play. A 20-3 run, highlighted by three 3-pointers by Watts and one by Pierce Hibma, made it 63-40 with 9:28 left. Creighton went ahead by 24 and a 10-2 run late in the game only made the score slightly more respectable as the Bluejays earned a sweep of the regular season series. Creighton won 61-58 two weeks ago in Des Moines. Funk had an incredible seven-minute spurt in the first half. After scoring only two points and missing two free throws in the first 10 1/2 minutes, he caught fire. He made two 3-pointers and another field goal to help the Bluejays to a 27-18 lead. Drake closed to 27-23 only to be hit with a 10-0 run by Creighton. It started with a field goal by Mathies and was followed by eight straight points by Funk, including back-to-back 3-pointers, for a 14-point lead. Drake scored the final four points of the half to trail 37-27.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
